content: fingerless or not gloves by paula mckeever snapper knits half fingers in a simple stockinette glove keeps hands warm and fingers free full fingers can be easily knit if preferred sized for men s small or ladies large pattern notes pattern can use any method of knitting in the round instructions allow for the slightly forward placement of the thumb palmward and the slightly lower position of the pinkie relative to the ring finger when working the fingers it is easy to use a second 2 50 mm needles instead of the stitch holders not only will it hold your stitches just leave the ends dangling materials out of the way but you can easily knit the stitches you need for the next finger as you come to it and leave the 50 grams fingering weight yarn rest on the needle size can be adjusted by changing needle size or gauge 2 25 and 2 50 mm needles either smaller fingers can be accommodated by casting on 3 double pointed or circular if using sts between fingers instead of 4 the magic loop method there may be holes or gaps at the base of the fingers these can be sewn up afterwards using yarn tails two stitch markers which need to be woven in anyway or you can try picking up extra sts at the beginning of the finger scrap yarn stitch holder or extra rounds for ring middle and index fingers as follows 2 50 mm needle pu an extra st in gap pu 4 sts along co edge pu another extra st in gap work rest of round as instructed tapestry needle on the next round decrease these extra sts by doing a k2tog or ssk if full gloves are desired simply keep knitting the gauge 8 5 sts = 1 inch in fingers until you are within 2-3 row of the tip then do stockinette stitch on 2 50 mm a couple of decrease rounds by knitting 2 sts together needles across the round pull yarn tail through remaining stitches and fasten_off instructions both hands co 64 sts with size 2 25 mm needles work k2p2 rib for 2 5 inches change to 2 50 mm needles and knit 10 rounds left hand thumb gusset row 1 k28 pm m1 k2 m1 pm k2 palm sts k32 back of hand row 2 & 3 knit repeat row 1-3 slipping markers as you come to them and knitting all sts in between markers repeat until there are 22 sts between markers work 2 more knit rounds next round k 28 sl next 22 sts onto waste yarn co 2 k34 work for 18 more rounds about 1 5 inches until you come to base of pinkie pinkie palm k7 for pinkie k 25 and place all sts on waste yarn or stitch holders back of hand k 25 and place all sts on waste yarn or stitch holders k7 next round k7 from the palm side co 4
